revision.comment: Reverted edits by [[Special:Contributions/213.120.244.39|213.120.244.39]] ([[User talk:213.120.244.39|talk]]): not providing a [[WP:RS|reliable source]] ([[WP:CITE]], [[WP:RS]]) ([[WP:HG|HG]]) (3.4.4)
revision.text:
{{pp-move-indef}} {{Use dmy dates|date=May 2012}} {{Use British English|date=May 2012}} {{Infobox comedian | image = | name = Matt Morgan | imagesize = | caption = | pseudonym = | birth_name = Matthew Morgan | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|df=yes|1977|8|10}} | birth_place = [[Dartford]], [[Kent]]
[[England]] | death_date = | death_place = | medium = [[Television]], [[Radio]] | nationality = [[United Kingdom|British]] | active = 2002–present | genre = | subject = | influences = | influenced = | spouse = Katie | children = 2 | notable_work = {{nowrap|[[The Russell Brand Show (radio show)|''The Russell Brand Show'']]}} | signature = | website = | footnotes = | current_members = | past_members = }} '''Matthew "Matt" Morgan''' is a British comedian, actor, writer, DJ and radio presenter. He is best known for his work with [[Russell Brand]], with whom he shared numerous writing credits, as well as co-hosting ''[[The Russell Brand Show (radio show)|The Russell Brand Show]]'' on [[BBC Radio 2]], [[BBC 6 Music]] and [[Radio X (United Kingdom)|Radio X]]. == Career == === Writing === Morgan met Russell Brand when he was working as an intern on MTV.[http://www.bbc.co.uk/6music/shows/russell_brand/biog1.shtml ''Russell Brand Show'' Biography] on bbc.co.uk/6music {{webarchive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20071018070855/http://www.bbc.co.uk/6music/shows/russell_brand/biog1.shtml |date=18 October 2007 }} He first joined with Brand after the presenter told him he had [[RE:Brand|a television show idea]] which was "good" and "commissioned", and that Morgan should work on it with him; Morgan later joked that neither of those things turned out to be true.The Russell Brand Show – BBC Radio 2 In 2010 Matt wrote and co-performed Borked TV with comedian [[Rufus Hound]] and others, a six-part series featuring comedy voiceovers dubbed over existing television material. === Radio === Morgan was the co-host of ''[[The Russell Brand Show (radio show)|The Russell Brand Show]]'' from its initial conception in 2006 on [[BBC 6 Music]] until its finish after Brand's resignation due to the [[The Russell Brand Show prank telephone calls row|prank telephone calls row]]. On the radio show, Morgan played the [[Straight man (stock character)|straight man]] to Brand's cheeky chappy persona, often mimicking Brand's [[Dot Cotton]]-esque accent and singing. In his memoir, ''[[Booky Wook 2]]'', Brand asserted that he and Morgan got into a row following Brand's controversial turn as the host of the 2008 MTV Video Music Awards (which the men co-wrote), and Morgan refused to return to the show.{{Citation | first = Brand| last = Russell | author-link = Russell Brand | title = Booky Wook 2: This Time It's Personal | place = London | publisher = HarperCollins | year = 2010 | page = 219 | isbn = 0-06-195807-7}}Walker, Kirsty (29 October 2008), [http://www.endofshow.com/2008/10/29/brandandross/ "The Ross and Russ Suspension – EOS Sticks Its Oar In" – 12:05 pm. EndofShow.com. Retrieved on 26 February 2011.] When Brand returned to talk radio in the Autumn of 2010, Morgan rejoined ''The Russell Brand Show''.NME staff. [http://www.nme.com/news/daily-gossip/53695 "Noel Gallagher and Russell Brand reunite – video – Daily Gossip"]. NME.com. Retrieved 26 February 2011. In September 2011, Morgan joined [[Noel Gallagher]] in co-hosting a show filling in for [[Dermot O'Leary]]. In March 2013, Morgan, along with Brand, Gallagher and Mr Gee, hosted a one-off radio show on XFM in aid of Teenage Cancer Trust. Morgan reunited with Brand and Mr Gee for ''The Russell Brand Podcast'', which began in February 2015 on [[audioBoom]]. In February 2016, Morgan reunited with Gallagher for a one-off radio show for [[Absolute Radio]]. In April 2017, Morgan reunited with [[Russell Brand]] and Greg "Mr Gee" Sekweyama for a new show on [[Radio X (United Kingdom)|Radio X]]. The initial contract was for a length of 6 months. === Internet === In 2014, Morgan appeared as a guest commentator on Brand's [[YouTube]] web series ''[[The Trews (Russell Brand)|The Trews]]'' on 23 July, 24 July and 8 August. == Personal life == On the 16 March 2013 (on the Russell Brand XFM Radio Show in aid of Teenage Cancer Trust) listeners learned that Matt and his wife Katie have a son named Coen named after Leonard Cohen. In 2016 their daughter, Winter was born. During June 2015, Matt ran a charity campaign for people suffering with 'Tonsil Stones' or 'Tonsilloliths'. He raised £808 for the cause which has been donated to 'TSRUK' (Tonsil Stone Relief UK). He was inspired to run the campaign as he himself has been a long term sufferer of this condition. == Credits == === Writing credits === * ''[[RE:Brand]]'' (2002) * ''[[Empire Square]]'' (2005) * ''[[1 Leicester Square]]'' (2006) * ''[[Russell Brand's Got Issues]]'' (2006) * ''[[The Russell Brand Show (television show)|The Russell Brand Show]]'' (2006) * ''[[The Kevin Bishop Show]]'' (2008) [http://www.comedy.org.uk/guide/tv/the_kevin_bishop_show/episodes/1/1/ The Kevin Bishop Show] British Comedy Guide * ''[[James Corden's World Cup Live]]'' (2010) [https://www.imdb.com/title/tt1688683/fullcredits#writers James Corden's World Cup Live]. IMDB * ''Borked TV'' (''The 5:19 Show'') (2010) * ''The Fun Police'' (2011) * ''[[Cardinal Burns]]'' (2012) * ''[[Very Important People]]'' (2012) * ''[[The Mimic]] '' (2014) * ''[[Sam Delaney's News Thing]]'' (2016) * ''[[Morgana Robinson's The Agency]]'' (2016) * ''[[Plebs (TV series)|Plebs]]'' (2016) * ''[[Murder in Successville]]'' (2017) * ''[[Hospital People]]'' (2017) === Presenting === * ''Russell Brand On the Road'' [http://www.bbc.co.uk/pressoffice/proginfo/tv/wk50/wed.shtml BBC – Press Office – Network TV Programme Information Week 50 Wednesday 12 December 2007] === Other roles === * ''[[Russell Brand's Ponderland]]'' (2007–2008) – Creative Director == Notes == {{reflist|30em}} == External links == * {{IMDb name|1831918|Matt Morgan}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Morgan, Matt}} [[Category:English male comedians]] [[Category:English radio personalities]] [[Category:English television writers]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People from Dartford]] [[Category:1977 births]]
